moves.1. e4: Hi everyone!  This game was played against a nine-year old boy called Adam.  Incredibly I was 20 years older than him when this was played.  This was to be my only game out of quite a few games against him that I would get anything other than The Blob, so I was really chuffed by this one victory.
moves.1... e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6: 5. ................... Qxf6 - this started off as a Winawer French.  I now eschew that exchange on f6 with the queen by playing Nbd7 to prepare Nf6 but this was how I used to play twelve years ago.
moves.6. Bd3 c5: 6. ................. c5 - an essential pawn break I feel.
moves.7. c3 cxd4 8. cxd4 Nc6 9. Nf3 Bb4+ 10. B: 11. ..................... Bd7 - now both sides have cleared wood off the back rank and have the option of where to castle and we both choose the kingside.
moves.12. Bb5 O-O 13. O-O Rad8 14. Bxc6 Bxc6 1: 15. Kte5?? - bad move - drops piece as the d pawn is pinned!
moves.15... Qxe5 16. dxe5 Rxd2: 16. .............. Rxd2 - not only has white lost a piece but just look where my rook is.  The squeeze is on!
moves.17. b4 Rfd8 18. a4 a6: 18. ................ a6.  After this move my opponent threw in the sponge.  Good win.
